participant_1.background:
I still play the drums to keep my hand-eye coordination and stamina in shape.
I do yoga every morning to keep my body healthy and flexible, but I'm not able to go to high altitudes because of my condition.
I put on my uniform and got ready to protect my city.
My most interesting experience was meeting one of my favorite celebrities and getting his autograph when I was growing up in New Hampshire.
I used to wear heels, but they are too uncomfortable.

content.text: I'm not doing too well, my wife left me and I'm feeling pretty down.
Oh no, I'm so sorry to hear that. What happened?
I don't really know, she just said she wasn't happy and she wanted to leave.
That's tough. I can't imagine how hard that must be.
It is. I don't know what to do.
Well, first of all, you need to take care of yourself. Make sure you're eating and sleeping, and try to get some exercise.
Yeah, I know. I've been trying to do that.
And don't be afraid to reach out for help. Talk to your friends and family, or see a therapist.
I've been thinking about seeing a therapist.
That's a good idea. They can help you process what you're going through and develop coping mechanisms.
No problem. And just remember, you're not alone. There are people who care about you and want to help.
